title: Rome opens two new Metro C stations, showcasing ancient ruins near Colosseum
description: Rome unveils two new Metro C stations near the Colosseum, featuring ancient artifacts. The project, nearly 20 years in the making, promises to ease city traffic.

title: Ancient Dental Plaque Is Changing What We Know About Medieval Diets
description: Learn more about a new technology that is turning ancient teeth into one of archaeology’s most powerful tools.

title: Why was Saffron Tea consumed in ancient civilizations?
description: Saffron, also known as Kesar, is an ancient and valuable spice prized for its rich color, aroma, and medicinal properties. Extracted from the Crocus sativus flower, it has been used for millennia in culinary traditions and for its health benefits, including mood enhancement and immune support. This premium spice offers a natural remedy for various ailments.
